result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
11:22 AM Defendant Jonathan R Jones appeared by zoom.  Attorney Theodore J. Skemp appeared by video for Jonathan R Jones.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Waive reading of the Information, stand mute to charges, court will enter a NG plea on behalf of DE. Adj 11:26
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:02 PM Defendant Jonathan R Jones appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore J. Skemp appeared by video for Jonathan R Jones.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls the case, hearing set for PH.  DE/Atty will waive PH. Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE makes waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently court will accept waiver of PH.  Set for Arraignment/Status October 21, 2022 @ 11:15am. Adj 1:08pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with any Walmarts or Verizon Stores.  No contact with JS, MM or their residences.  Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)

1:50 PM Defendant Jonathan R Jones in court with Attorney Atty Ted Skemp.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE/Atty will waive TL for PH.  Atty would like to be heard on bond, asking for a sign bond. The court will reduce bond to $5000.00 cash.  Set for PH August 31, 2022 @ 1:00pm. ZOOM.
Letter dated 7/25/22 from Atty Theodore J Skemp requesting appearance via Zoom for Init App scheduled August 2, 2022

7:57 AM Defendant Jonathan R Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laurie Osberg from PD office appeared with the DE.  Matter set for a bond hearing.  Court previously found PC.   State has contacted victims in this matter.  State argued for $7500 cash bond with conditions no contact with all Walmarts, all Verizons, J.S. and M.M. and M.M.'s residence. Attorney Osberg has not spoken with DE as of this date.  Attorney Osberg requested court be scheduled for INIT asap.  DE provided a statement as to his background.   8:03 AM Attorney Osberg and DE enter breakout room.  8:25 AM Parties back on the record.  ADA Emily Nelson now in another hearing and not present for remainder of bond hearing.  Attorney Osberg informed Court DE does not qualify for PD representation.   Attorney Osberg handled bond hearing and updated Court on DE background.   Attorney Osberg req. a $2000 cash bond.  Court made findings and ORDERED a $7500 cash bond with conditions that he have no contact with any Walmarts, any Verizon stores, no contact with J.S. or M.M. or their residences.    INIT set for 8/2/22 at 1:00 PM.  Adj. 8:30 AM

No contact with any Walmarts or Verizon Stores.  No contact with JS, MM or their residences.  Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)
